com.wm.pkg.sap.idoc
Class IDOC

java.lang.Object
  com.wm.pkg.sap.idoc.IDOC
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDocConstants
Deprecated. As of SAP Adapter version 7.1, replaced by the webMethods IDoc Java API. 

public class IDOC
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDocConstants

This type enables IDoc processing. It allows you to use the content of an IDoc for target determination purposes on the client side or to adopt the content for your needs on the server side. To enable these possibilities this class provides methods that allow you to retrieve values, change IDoc entries, search for certain segments or even to insert a new IDoc. Note: This class can not handle IDoc packages yet.

See Also:
IDOCControl, IDOCSegment

findSegment

public IDOCSegment findSegment(java.lang.String segmentName)
Deprecated. As of SAP Adapter version 7.1, replaced by the webMethods IDoc Java API.

Looks for a certain segment in the IDoc and returns the IDOCSegment object. If the segment is not found, null is returned.

Parameters:
segmentName - The name of the segment you look for.
Returns:
the reference to the IDOCSegment object from this IDoc matching the provided segment name.

findSegment

public IDOCSegment findSegment(java.lang.String segmentName,
                               java.lang.String fieldName,
                               java.lang.String value)
Deprecated. As of SAP Adapter version 7.1, replaced by the webMethods IDoc Java API.

Looks for a certain segment in this IDoc and returns the IDOCSegment object. Search criteria are the segment name, where fieldName matches value. If the segment is not found, null is returned.

Parameters:
segmentName - The name of the segment you look for.
fieldName - The name of a field you want to check.
value - The desired value as a String.

findSegment

public IDOCSegment findSegment(java.lang.String segmentName,
                               int from)
Deprecated. As of SAP Adapter version 7.1, replaced by the webMethods IDoc Java API.

Looks for a certain segment in the IDoc and returns the IDOCSegment object. Begins searching at segment with index from. If the segment is not found, null is returned.

Parameters:
segmentName - The name of the segment you look for.
from - The search is started at this index.

put

public java.lang.Object put(int segmentNumber,
                            java.lang.String segmentName,
                            java.lang.String fieldName,
                            java.lang.String value)
                     throws com.wm.app.b2b.server.ServiceException
Deprecated. As of SAP Adapter version 7.1, replaced by the webMethods IDoc Java API.

Sets the given value for a field in a segment of the IDoc. The segmentNumber is the key of the put, which is used to retrieve a segment. The segmentName is used for validation purposes; you can only access the segment, if its name is equivalent to segmentName. In this case the value of the field fieldName is set to value.

Parameters:
segmentNumber - The index of the segment in the IDoc
segmentName - The name of the segment
fieldName - The field you want change
value - The new value as a String
Throws:
com.wm.app.b2b.server.ServiceException - if segmentName and the name of the segment at position segmentNumber are not equal.

insert

public void insert(int count,
                   java.lang.String segmentName,
                   IDOCSegment newSegment)
Deprecated. As of SAP Adapter version 7.1, replaced by the webMethods IDoc Java API.

Inserts a segment after the countth occurence of a segment of type segmentName.

Parameters:
segmentName - The name of the segment after which you want to insert.
newSegment - The segment which is inserted.
count - Number of occurences of the segment before inserting the new segment.
See Also:
IDOCSegment

insert

public void insert(int count,
                   java.lang.String segmentName,
                   IDOCSegment newSegment,
                   int offset,
                   boolean asChild)
Deprecated. As of SAP Adapter version 7.1, replaced by the webMethods IDoc Java API.

Inserts a segment after the countth occurence of a segment of type segmentName after the index offset. The segment will be put into the same hlevel as the segment after which it was inserted, if the following segment is not a child of this segment. If asChild is true, the segment is forced to be inserted as child.

Parameters:
count - Number of occurences of the segment before inserting the new segment.
segmentName - The name of the segment after which you want to insert.
newSegment - The segment which is inserted.
offset - The offset for the start of the search for the insert position.
asChild - Specifies whether to force insertion as a child.
See Also:
IDOCSegment
